function.name: accessibleProperties
function.help: Use this method to specify which properties can be set through mass assignment.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Property name (or list of property names) that are allowed to be altered through mass assignment.

function.name: addDefaultRoutes
function.help: Adds the default Wheels routes (for example, `[controller]/[action]/[key]`, etc.) to your application. Only use this method if you have set `loadDefaultRoutes` to `false` and want to control exactly where in the route order you want to place the default routes.

function.name: addError
function.help: Adds an error on a specific property.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property you want to add an error on.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: The error message (such as "Please enter a correct name in the form field" for example).

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name to identify the error by (useful when you need to distinguish one error from another one set on the same object and you don't want to use the error message itself for that).

function.name: addErrorToBase
function.help: Adds an error on the object as a whole (not related to any specific property).

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: The error message (such as "Please enter a correct name in the form field" for example).

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name to identify the error by (useful when you need to distinguish one error from another one set on the same object and you don't want to use the error message itself for that).

function.name: addFormat
function.help: Adds a new MIME format to your Wheels application for use with responding to multiple formats.

parameter.name: extension
parameter.help: File extension to add.

parameter.name: mimeType
parameter.help: Matching MIME type to associate with the file extension.

function.name: addRoute
function.help: Adds a new route to your application.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the route. This is referenced as the `name` argument in functions based on @URLFor like @linkTo, @startFormTag, etc.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: The URL pattern that the route will match.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.help: Controller to call when route matches (unless the controller name exists in the pattern).

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Action to call when route matches (unless the action name exists in the pattern).

function.name: afterCreate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after a new object is created.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterDelete
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after an object is deleted.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterFind
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after an existing object has been initialized (which is usually done with the @findByKey or @findOne method).

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterInitialization
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after an object has been initialized.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterNew
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after a new object has been initialized (which is usually done with the @new method).

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterSave
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after an object is saved.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterUpdate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after an existing object is updated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterValidation
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after an object is validated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterValidationOnCreate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after a new object is validated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: afterValidationOnUpdate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called after an existing object is validated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: allChanges
function.help: Returns a struct detailing all changes that have been made on the object but not yet saved to the database.

function.name: allErrors
function.help: Returns an array of all the errors on the object.

function.name: autoLink
function.help: Turns all URLs and email addresses into hyperlinks.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text to create links in.

parameter.name: link
parameter.help: Whether to link URLs, email addresses or both. Possible values are: `all` (default), `URLs` and `emailAddresses`.

function.name: automaticValidations
function.help: Whether or not to enable default validations for this model.

function.name: average
function.help: Calculates the average value for a given property. Uses the SQL function `AVG`. If no records can be found to perform the calculation on you can use the `ifNull` argument to decide what should be returned.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of the property to calculate the average for.

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: include
parameter.help: Associations that should be included in the query using `INNER` or `LEFT OUTER` joins (which join type that is used depends on how the association has been set up in your model). If all included associations are set on the current model, you can specify them in a list (e.g. `department,addresses,emails`). You can build more complex `include` strings by using parentheses when the association is set on an included model, like `album(artist(genre))`, for example. These complex `include` strings only work when `returnAs` is set to `query` though.

parameter.name: distinct
parameter.help: When `true`, `AVG` will be performed only on each unique instance of a value, regardless of how many times the value occurs.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: ifNull
parameter.help: The value returned if no records are found. Common usage is to set this to `0` to make sure a numeric value is always returned instead of a blank string.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: beforeCreate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called before a new object is created.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: beforeDelete
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called before an object is deleted.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: beforeSave
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called before an object is saved.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: beforeUpdate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called before an existing object is updated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: beforeValidation
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called before an object is validated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: beforeValidationOnCreate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called before a new object is validated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: beforeValidationOnUpdate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called before an existing object is validated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names that should be called when this callback event occurs in an object's life cycle (can also be called with the `method` argument).

function.name: belongsTo
function.help: Sets up a `belongsTo` association between this model and the specified one. Use this association when this model contains a foreign key referencing another model.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Gives the association a name that you refer to when working with the association (in the `include` argument to @findAll, to name one example).

parameter.name: modelName
parameter.help: Name of associated model (usually not needed if you follow Wheels conventions because the model name will be deduced from the `name` argument).

parameter.name: foreignKey
parameter.help: Foreign key property name (usually not needed if you follow Wheels conventions since the foreign key name will be deduced from the `name` argument).

parameter.name: joinType
parameter.help: Use to set the join type when joining associated tables. Possible values are `inner` (for `INNER JOIN`) and `outer` (for `LEFT OUTER JOIN`).

function.name: buttonTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a button `form` control.

parameter.name: content
parameter.help: Content to display inside the button.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The type for the button: `button`, `reset`, or `submit`.

parameter.name: image
parameter.help: File name of the image file to use in the button form control.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The value of the button when submitted.

parameter.name: disable
parameter.help: Whether or not to disable the button upon clicking. (Prevents double-clicking.)

function.name: buttonTo
function.help: Creates a form containing a single button that submits to the URL. The URL is built the same way as the @linkTo function.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text content of the button.

parameter.name: confirm
parameter.help: Pass a message here to cause a JavaScript confirmation dialog box to pop up containing the message.

parameter.name: image
parameter.help: If you want to use an image for the button pass in the link to it here (relative from the `images` folder).

parameter.name: disable
parameter.help: Pass in `true` if you want the button to be disabled when clicked (can help prevent multiple clicks), or pass in a string if you want the button disabled and the text on the button updated (to "please wait...", for example).

parameter.name: route
parameter.help: Name of a route that you have configured in `config/routes.cfm`.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.help: Name of the controller to include in the URL.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Name of the action to include in the URL.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key(s) to include in the URL.

parameter.name: params
parameter.help: Any additional params to be set in the query string.

parameter.name: anchor
parameter.help: Sets an anchor name to be appended to the path.

parameter.name: onlyPath
parameter.help: If `true`, returns only the relative URL (no protocol, host name or port).

parameter.name: host
parameter.help: Set this to override the current host.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: Set this to override the current protocol.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Set this to override the current port number.

function.name: caches
function.help: Tells Wheels to cache one or more actions.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Action(s) to cache. This argument is also aliased as `actions`.

parameter.name: time
parameter.help: Minutes to cache the action(s) for.

parameter.name: static
parameter.help: Set to `true` to tell Wheels that this is a static page and that it can skip running the controller filters (before and after filters set on actions) and application events (onSessionStart, onRequestStart etc).

function.name: capitalize
function.help: Returns the text with the first character converted to uppercase.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Text to capitalize.

function.name: changedFrom
function.help: Returns the previous value of a property that has changed. Returns an empty string if no previous value exists. Wheels will keep a note of the previous property value until the object is saved to the database.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of property to get the previous value for.

function.name: changedProperties
function.help: Returns a list of the object properties that have been changed but not yet saved to the database.

function.name: checkBox
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a check box form control based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`. In most cases, this function generates a form field that should represent a `boolean` style field in your data. Use @checkBoxTag or @hasManyCheckBox to generate check boxes for selecting multiple values. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: checkedValue
parameter.help: The value of the check box when it's in the `checked` state.

parameter.name: uncheckedValue
parameter.help: The value of the check box when it's in the `unchecked` state.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

function.name: checkBoxTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a check box form control based on the supplied `name`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: checked
parameter.help: Whether or not the check box should be checked by default.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value of check box in its `checked` state.

parameter.name: uncheckedValue
parameter.help: The value of the check box when it's on the `unchecked` state.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

function.name: clearErrors
function.help: Clears out all errors set on the object or only the ones set for a specific property or name.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Specify a property name here if you want to clear all errors set on that property.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specify an error name here if you want to clear all errors set with that error name.

function.name: columnDataForProperty
function.help: Returns a struct with data for the named property.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of column to retrieve data for.

function.name: columnForProperty
function.help: Returns the column name mapped for the named model property.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of property to inspect.

function.name: columnNames
function.help: Returns a list of column names in the table mapped to this model. The list is ordered according to the columns' ordinal positions in the database table.

function.name: columns
function.help: Returns an array of columns names for the table associated with this class. Does not include calculated properties that will be generated by the Wheels ORM.

function.name: compareTo
function.help: Pass in another Wheels model object to see if the two objects are the same.

function.name: contentFor
function.help: Used to store a section's output for rendering within a layout. This content store acts as a stack, so you can store multiple pieces of content for a given section.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position in the section's stack where you want the content placed. Valid values are `first`, `last`, or the numeric position.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Whether or not to overwrite any of the content. Valid values are `false`, `true`, or `all`.

function.name: contentForLayout
function.help: Includes content for the `body` section, which equates to the output generated by the view template run by the request.

function.name: controller
function.help: Creates and returns a controller object with your own custom `name` and `params`. Used primarily for testing purposes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the controller to create.

parameter.name: params
parameter.help: The params struct (combination of `form` and `URL` variables).

function.name: count
function.help: Returns the number of rows that match the arguments (or all rows if no arguments are passed in). Uses the SQL function `COUNT`. If no records can be found to perform the calculation on, `0` is returned.

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: include
parameter.help: Associations that should be included in the query using `INNER` or `LEFT OUTER` joins (which join type that is used depends on how the association has been set up in your model). If all included associations are set on the current model, you can specify them in a list (e.g. `department,addresses,emails`). You can build more complex `include` strings by using parentheses when the association is set on an included model, like `album(artist(genre))`, for example. These complex `include` strings only work when `returnAs` is set to `query` though.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: create
function.help: Creates a new object, saves it to the database (if the validation permits it), and returns it. If the validation fails, the unsaved object (with errors added to it) is still returned. Property names and values can be passed in either using named arguments or as a struct to the `properties` argument.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: The properties you want to set on the object (can also be passed in as named arguments).

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: reload
parameter.help: Set to `true` to reload the object from the database once an insert/update has completed.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

function.name: cycle
function.help: Cycles through list values every time it is called.

parameter.name: values
parameter.help: List of values to cycle through.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to give the cycle. Useful when you use multiple cycles on a page.

function.name: dataSource
function.help: Use this method to override the data source connection information for this model.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: The data source name to connect to.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: The username for the data source.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: The password for the data source.

function.name: dateSelect
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing three select form controls for month, day, and year based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: order
parameter.help: Use to change the order of or exclude date select tags.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Use to change the character that is displayed between the date select tags.

parameter.name: startYear
parameter.help: First year in select list.

parameter.name: endYear
parameter.help: Last year in select list.

parameter.name: monthDisplay
parameter.help: Pass in `names`, `numbers`, or `abbreviations` to control display.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control. The label will be applied to all `select` tags, but you can pass in a list to cutomize each one individually.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

parameter.name: combine
parameter.help: Set to `false` to not combine the select parts into a single `DateTime` object.

function.name: dateSelectTags
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing three select form controls (month, day, and year) based on a `name` and `value`.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: Value of option that should be selected by default.

parameter.name: order
parameter.help: Use to change the order of or exclude date select tags.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Use to change the character that is displayed between the date select tags.

parameter.name: startYear
parameter.help: First year in select list.

parameter.name: endYear
parameter.help: Last year in select list.

parameter.name: monthDisplay
parameter.help: Pass in `names`, `numbers`, or `abbreviations` to control display.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control. The label will be applied to all `select` tags, but you can pass in a list to cutomize each one individually.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: combine
parameter.help: Set to `false` to not combine the select parts into a single `DateTime` object.

function.name: dateTimeSelect
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing six select form controls (three for date selection and the remaining three for time selection) based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: dateOrder
parameter.help: Use to change the order of or exclude date select tags.

parameter.name: dateSeparator
parameter.help: Use to change the character that is displayed between the date select tags.

parameter.name: startYear
parameter.help: First year in select list.

parameter.name: endYear
parameter.help: Last year in select list.

parameter.name: monthDisplay
parameter.help: Pass in `names`, `numbers`, or `abbreviations` to control display.

parameter.name: timeOrder
parameter.help: Use to change the order of or exclude time select tags.

parameter.name: timeSeparator
parameter.help: Use to change the character that is displayed between the time select tags.

parameter.name: minuteStep
parameter.help: Pass in `10` to only show minute 10, 20, 30, etc.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Use to change the character that is displayed between the first and second set of select tags.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control. The label will be applied to all `select` tags, but you can pass in a list to cutomize each one individually.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel

parameter.name: twelveHour

function.name: dateTimeSelectTags

function.name: delete
function.help: Deletes the object, which means the row is deleted from the database (unless prevented by a `beforeDelete` callback). Returns `true` on successful deletion of the row, `false` otherwise.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

parameter.name: softDelete
parameter.help: Set to `false` to permanently delete a record, even if it has a soft delete column.

function.name: deleteAll
function.help: Deletes all records that match the `where` argument. By default, objects will not be instantiated and therefore callbacks and validations are not invoked. You can change this behavior by passing in `instantiate=true`. Returns the number of records that were deleted.

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: include
parameter.help: Associations that should be included in the query using `INNER` or `LEFT OUTER` joins (which join type that is used depends on how the association has been set up in your model). If all included associations are set on the current model, you can specify them in a list (e.g. `department,addresses,emails`). You can build more complex `include` strings by using parentheses when the association is set on an included model, like `album(artist(genre))`, for example. These complex `include` strings only work when `returnAs` is set to `query` though.

parameter.name: reload
parameter.help: Set to `true` to force Wheels to query the database even though an identical query may have been run in the same request. (The default in Wheels is to get the second query from the request-level cache.)

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: instantiate
parameter.help: Whether or not to instantiate the object(s) first. When objects are not instantiated, any callbacks and validations set on them will be skipped.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

parameter.name: softDelete
parameter.help: Set to `false` to permanently delete a record, even if it has a soft delete column.

function.name: deleteByKey
function.help: Finds the record with the supplied key and deletes it. Returns `true` on successful deletion of the row, `false` otherwise.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Primary key value(s) of the record to fetch. Separate with comma if passing in multiple primary key values. Accepts a string, list, or a numeric value.

parameter.name: reload

parameter.name: softDelete
parameter.help: Set to `false` to permanently delete a record, even if it has a soft delete column.

parameter.name: toTime

parameter.name: includeSeconds

function.name: endFormTag

function.name: errorCount
function.help: Returns the number of errors this object has associated with it. Specify `property` or `name` if you wish to count only specific errors.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Specify a property name here if you want to count only errors set on a specific property.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specify an error name here if you want to count only errors set with a specific error name.

function.name: errorMessageOn
function.help: Returns the error message, if one exists, on the object's property. If multiple error messages exist, the first one is returned.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to display the error message for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to display the error message for.

parameter.name: prependText
parameter.help: String to prepend to the error message.

parameter.name: appendText
parameter.help: String to append to the error message.

parameter.name: wrapperElement
parameter.help: HTML element to wrap the error message in.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: CSS class to set on the wrapper element.

function.name: errorMessagesFor
function.help: Builds and returns a list (`ul` tag with a class of `error-messages`) containing all the error messages for all the properties of the object (if any). Returns an empty string otherwise.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to display error messages for.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: CSS class to set on the `ul` element.

parameter.name: showDuplicates
parameter.help: Whether or not to show duplicate error messages.

function.name: errorsOn
function.help: Returns an array of all errors associated with the supplied property (and error name if passed in).

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Specify the property name to return errors for here.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: If you want to return only errors on the above property set with a specific error name you can specify it here.

function.name: errorsOnBase
function.help: Returns an array of all errors associated with the object as a whole (not related to any specific property).

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specify an error name here to only return errors for that error name.

function.name: excerpt
function.help: Extracts an excerpt from text that matches the first instance of a given phrase.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text to extract an excerpt from.

parameter.name: phrase
parameter.help: The phrase to extract.

parameter.name: radius
parameter.help: Number of characters to extract surrounding the phrase.

parameter.name: excerptString
parameter.help: String to replace first and/or last characters with.

parameter.name: key

parameter.name: where

function.name: fileField
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a file field form control based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

function.name: filterChain
function.help: Returns an array of all the filters set on this controller in the order in which they will be executed.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Use this argument to return only `before` or `after` filters.

function.name: filters
function.help: Tells Wheels to run a function before an action is run or after an action has been run. You can also specify multiple functions and actions.

parameter.name: through
parameter.help: Function(s) to execute before or after the action(s).

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Whether to run the function(s) before or after the action(s).

parameter.name: only
parameter.help: Pass in a list of action names (or one action name) to tell Wheels that the filter function(s) should only be run on these actions.

parameter.name: except
parameter.help: Pass in a list of action names (or one action name) to tell Wheels that the filter function(s) should be run on all actions except the specified ones.

function.name: findAll
function.help: Returns records from the database table mapped to this model according to the arguments passed in. (Use the `where` argument to decide which records to get, use the `order` argument to set in what order those records should be returned, and so on). The records will be returned as either a `cfquery` result set or an array of objects (depending on what the `returnAs` argument is set to). Instead of using the `where` argument, you can create cleaner code by making use of a concept called dynamic finders.

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: order
parameter.help: Maps to the `ORDER BY` clause of the query. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Maps to the `GROUP BY` clause of the query. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: select
parameter.help: Determines how the `SELECT` clause for the query used to return data will look. You can pass in a list of the properties (which map to columns) that you want returned from your table(s). If you don't set this argument at all, Wheels will select all properties from your table(s). If you specify a table name (e.g. `users.email`) or alias a column (e.g. `fn AS firstName`) in the list, then the entire list will be passed through unchanged and used in the `SELECT` clause of the query. By default, all column names in tables `JOIN`ed via the `include` argument will be prepended with the singular version of the included table name.

parameter.name: distinct
parameter.help: Whether to add the `DISTINCT` keyword to your `SELECT` clause. Wheels will, when necessary, add this automatically (when using pagination and a `hasMany` association is used in the `include` argument, to name one example).

parameter.name: include
parameter.help: Associations that should be included in the query using `INNER` or `LEFT OUTER` joins (which join type that is used depends on how the association has been set up in your model). If all included associations are set on the current model, you can specify them in a list (e.g. `department,addresses,emails`). You can build more complex `include` strings by using parentheses when the association is set on an included model, like `album(artist(genre))`, for example. These complex `include` strings only work when `returnAs` is set to `query` though.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.help: Maximum number of records to retrieve. Passed on to the `maxRows` `cfquery` attribute. The default, `-1`, means that all records will be retrieved.

parameter.name: page
parameter.help: If you want to paginate records, you can do so by specifying a page number here. For example, getting records 11-20 would be page number 2 when `perPage` is kept at the default setting (10 records per page). The default, `0`, means that records won't be paginated and that the `perPage`, `count`, and `handle` arguments will be ignored.

parameter.name: perPage
parameter.help: When using pagination, you can specify how many records you want to fetch per page here. This argument is only used when the `page` argument has been passed in.

parameter.name: count
parameter.help: When using pagination and you know in advance how many records you want to paginate through, you can pass in that value here. Doing so will prevent Wheels from running a `COUNT` query to get this value. This argument is only used when the `page` argument has been passed in.

parameter.name: handle
parameter.help: Handle to use for the query in pagination. This is useful when you're paginating multiple queries and need to reference them in the @paginationLinks function, for example. This argument is only used when the `page` argument has been passed in.

parameter.name: cache
parameter.help: If you want to cache the query, you can do so by specifying the number of minutes you want to cache the query for here. If you set it to `true`, the default cache time will be used (60 minutes).

parameter.name: reload
parameter.help: Set to `true` to force Wheels to query the database even though an identical query may have been run in the same request. (The default in Wheels is to get the second query from the request-level cache.)

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: returnAs
parameter.help: Set this to `objects` to return an array of objects. Set this to `query` to return a query result set.

parameter.name: returnIncluded
parameter.help: When `returnAs` is set to `objects`, you can set this argument to `false` to prevent returning objects fetched from associations specified in the `include` argument. This is useful when you only need to include associations for use in the `WHERE` clause only and want to avoid the performance hit that comes with object creation.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `false` to prevent running the execution of callbacks for a method call.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: findByKey
