parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: flash
function.help: Returns the value of a specific key in the Flash (or the entire Flash as a struct if no key is passed in).

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: The key to get the value for.

function.name: flashClear
function.help: Deletes everything from the Flash.

function.name: flashCount
function.help: Returns how many keys exist in the Flash.

function.name: flashDelete
function.help: Deletes a specific key from the Flash.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: The key to delete.

function.name: flashInsert
function.help: Inserts a new key/value into the Flash.

function.name: flashIsEmpty
function.help: Returns whether or not the Flash is empty.

function.name: flashKeep
function.help: Make the entire Flash or specific key in it stick around for one more request.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: A key or list of keys to flag for keeping. This argument is also aliased as `keys`.

function.name: flashKeyExists
function.help: Checks if a specific key exists in the Flash.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: The key to check if it exists.

function.name: flashMessages
function.help: Displays a marked-up listing of messages that exists in the Flash.

parameter.name: keys
parameter.help: The key (or list of keys) to show the value for. You can also use the `key` argument instead for better readability when accessing a single key.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: HTML `class` to set on the `div` element that contains the messages.

parameter.name: includeEmptyContainer
parameter.help: Includes the DIV container even if the flash is empty.

parameter.name: lowerCaseDynamicClassValues
parameter.help: Outputs all class attribute values in lower case (except the main one).

function.name: get
function.help: Returns the current setting for the supplied Wheels setting or the current default for the supplied Wheels function argument.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Variable name to get setting for.

parameter.name: functionName
parameter.help: Function name to get setting for.

function.name: getTableNamePrefix
function.help: Returns the table name prefix set for the table.

function.name: hasChanged
function.help: Returns `true` if the specified property (or any if none was passed in) has been changed but not yet saved to the database. Will also return `true` if the object is new and no record for it exists in the database.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of property to check for change.

function.name: hasErrors
function.help: Returns `true` if the object has any errors. You can also limit to only check a specific property or name for errors.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of the property to check if there are any errors set on.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Error name to check if there are any errors set with.

function.name: hasMany
function.help: Sets up a `hasMany` association between this model and the specified one.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Gives the association a name that you refer to when working with the association (in the `include` argument to @findAll, to name one example).

parameter.name: modelName
parameter.help: Name of associated model (usually not needed if you follow Wheels conventions because the model name will be deduced from the `name` argument).

parameter.name: foreignKey
parameter.help: Foreign key property name (usually not needed if you follow Wheels conventions since the foreign key name will be deduced from the `name` argument).

parameter.name: joinType
parameter.help: Use to set the join type when joining associated tables. Possible values are `inner` (for `INNER JOIN`) and `outer` (for `LEFT OUTER JOIN`).

parameter.name: dependent
parameter.help: Defines how to handle dependent models when you delete a record from this model. Set to `delete` to instantiate associated models and call their @delete method, `deleteAll` to delete without instantiating, `nullify` to remove the foreign key, or `false` to do nothing.

parameter.name: shortcut
parameter.help: Set this argument to create an additional dynamic method that gets the object(s) from the other side of a many-to-many association.

parameter.name: through
parameter.help: Set this argument if you need to override Wheels conventions when using the `shortcut` argument. Accepts a list of two association names representing the chain from the opposite side of the many-to-many relationship to this model.

function.name: hasManyCheckBox
function.help: Used as a shortcut to output the proper form elements for an association. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: Name of the variable containing the parent object to represent with this form field.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: Name of the association set in the parent object to represent with this form field.

parameter.name: keys
parameter.help: Primary keys associated with this form field.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

function.name: hasManyRadioButton
function.help: Used as a shortcut to output the proper form elements for an association. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: Name of the variable containing the parent object to represent with this form field.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: Name of the association set in the parent object to represent with this form field.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of the property in the child object to represent with this form field.

parameter.name: keys
parameter.help: Primary keys associated with this form field.

parameter.name: tagValue
parameter.help: The value of the radio button when `selected`.

parameter.name: checkIfBlank
parameter.help: Whether or not to check this form field as a default if there is a blank value set for the property.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

function.name: hasOne
function.help: Sets up a `hasOne` association between this model and the specified one.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Gives the association a name that you refer to when working with the association (in the `include` argument to @findAll, to name one example).

parameter.name: modelName
parameter.help: Name of associated model (usually not needed if you follow Wheels conventions because the model name will be deduced from the `name` argument).

parameter.name: foreignKey
parameter.help: Foreign key property name (usually not needed if you follow Wheels conventions since the foreign key name will be deduced from the `name` argument).

parameter.name: joinType
parameter.help: Use to set the join type when joining associated tables. Possible values are `inner` (for `INNER JOIN`) and `outer` (for `LEFT OUTER JOIN`).

parameter.name: dependent
parameter.help: Defines how to handle dependent models when you delete a record from this model. Set to `delete` to instantiate associated models and call their @delete method, `deleteAll` to delete without instantiating, `nullify` to remove the foreign key, or `false` to do nothing.

function.name: hasProperty
function.help: Returns `true` if the specified property name exists on the model.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of property to inspect.

function.name: hiddenField
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a hidden field form control based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

function.name: hiddenFieldTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a hidden field form control based on the supplied `name`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to populate in tag's `value` attribute.

function.name: highlight
function.help: Highlights the phrase(s) everywhere in the text if found by wrapping it in a `span` tag.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Text to search.

parameter.name: phrases
parameter.help: List of phrases to highlight.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: Class to use in `span` tags surrounding highlighted phrase(s).

function.name: hourSelectTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing one select form control for the hours of the day based on the supplied `name`.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: The hour that should be selected initially.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: twelveHour
parameter.help: whether to display the hours in 24 or 12 hour format. 12 hour format has AM/PM drop downs

function.name: humanize
function.help: Returns readable text by capitalizing and converting camel casing to multiple words.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Text to humanize.

parameter.name: except
parameter.help: a list of strings (space separated) to replace within the output.

function.name: hyphenize
function.help: Converts camelCase strings to lowercase strings with hyphens as word delimiters instead. Example: `myVariable` becomes `my-variable`.

parameter.name: string
parameter.help: The string to hyphenize.

function.name: imageTag
function.help: Returns an `img` tag. If the image is stored in the local `images` folder, the tag will also set the `width`, `height`, and `alt` attributes for you. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: The file name of the image if it's availabe in the local file system (i.e. ColdFusion will be able to access it). Provide the full URL if the image is on a remote server.

function.name: includeContent
function.help: Used to output the content for a particular section in a layout.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of layout section to return content for.

parameter.name: default
parameter.help: What to display as a default if the section is not defined.

function.name: includedInObject
function.help: Used as a shortcut to check if the specified IDs are a part of the main form object. This method should only be used for `hasMany` associations.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: Name of the variable containing the parent object to represent with this form field.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: Name of the association set in the parent object to represent with this form field.

parameter.name: keys
parameter.help: Primary keys associated with this form field.

function.name: includeLayout
function.help: Includes the contents of another layout file. This is usually used to include a parent layout from within a child layout.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the layout file to include.

function.name: includePartial
function.help: Includes the specified partial file in the view. Similar to using `cfinclude` but with the ability to cache the result and use Wheels-specific file look-up. By default, Wheels will look for the file in the current controller's view folder. To include a file relative from the base `views` folder, you can start the path supplied to `name` with a forward slash.

parameter.name: partial
parameter.help: The name of the partial file to be used. Prefix with a leading slash `/` if you need to build a path from the root `views` folder. Do not include the partial filename's underscore and file extension.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: If passing a query result set for the `partial` argument, use this to specify the field to group the query by. A new query will be passed into the partial template for you to iterate over.

parameter.name: cache
parameter.help: Number of minutes to cache the content for.

parameter.name: layout
parameter.help: The layout to wrap the content in. Prefix with a leading slash `/` if you need to build a path from the root `views` folder. Pass `false` to not load a layout at all.

parameter.name: spacer
parameter.help: HTML or string to place between partials when called using a query.

parameter.name: dataFunction
parameter.help: Name of controller function to load data from.

function.name: invokeWithTransaction
function.help: Runs the specified method within a single database transaction.

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: Model method to run.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: isolation
parameter.help: Isolation level to be passed through to the `cftransaction` tag. See your CFML engine's documentation for more details about `cftransaction`'s `isolation` attribute.

function.name: isAjax
function.help: Returns whether the page was called from JavaScript or not.

function.name: isClass
function.help: Use this method within a model's method to check whether you are currently in a class-level object.

function.name: isGet
function.help: Returns whether the request was a normal `GET` request or not.

function.name: isInstance
function.help: Use this method to check whether you are currently in an instance object.

function.name: isNew
function.help: Returns `true` if this object hasn't been saved yet. (In other words, no matching record exists in the database yet.) Returns `false` if a record exists.

function.name: isPost
function.help: Returns whether the request came from a form `POST` submission or not.

function.name: isSecure
function.help: Returns whether Wheels is communicating over a secure port.

function.name: javaScriptIncludeTag
function.help: Returns a `script` tag for a JavaScript file (or several) based on the supplied arguments.

parameter.name: sources
parameter.help: The name of one or many JavaScript files in the `javascripts` folder, minus the `.js` extension. (Can also be called with the `source` argument.)

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The `type` attribute for the `script` tag.

parameter.name: head
parameter.help: Set to `true` to place the output in the `head` area of the HTML page instead of the default behavior, which is to place the output where the function is called from.

function.name: key
function.help: Returns the value of the primary key for the object. If you have a single primary key named `id`, then `someObject.key()` is functionally equivalent to `someObject.id`. This method is more useful when you do dynamic programming and don't know the name of the primary key or when you use composite keys (in which case it's convenient to use this method to get a list of both key values returned).

function.name: linkTo
function.help: Creates a link to another page in your application. Pass in the name of a `route` to use your configured routes or a `controller`/`action`/`key` combination. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text content of the link.

parameter.name: confirm
parameter.help: Pass a message here to cause a JavaScript confirmation dialog box to pop up containing the message.

parameter.name: route
parameter.help: Name of a route that you have configured in `config/routes.cfm`.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.help: Name of the controller to include in the URL.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Name of the action to include in the URL.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key(s) to include in the URL.

parameter.name: params
parameter.help: Any additional params to be set in the query string.

parameter.name: anchor
parameter.help: Sets an anchor name to be appended to the path.

parameter.name: onlyPath
parameter.help: If `true`, returns only the relative URL (no protocol, host name or port).

parameter.name: host
parameter.help: Set this to override the current host.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: Set this to override the current protocol.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Set this to override the current port number.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: Pass a link to an external site here if you want to bypass the Wheels routing system altogether and link to an external URL.

function.name: mailTo
function.help: Creates a `mailto` link tag to the specified email address, which is also used as the name of the link unless name is specified.

parameter.name: emailAddress
parameter.help: The email address to link to.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A string to use as the link text ("Joe" or "Support Department", for example).

parameter.name: encode
parameter.help: Pass `true` here to encode the email address, making it harder for bots to harvest it for example.

function.name: maximum
function.help: Calculates the maximum value for a given property. Uses the SQL function `MAX`. If no records can be found to perform the calculation on you can use the `ifNull` argument to decide what should be returned.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of the property to get the highest value for (must be a property of a numeric data type).

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: include
parameter.help: Associations that should be included in the query using `INNER` or `LEFT OUTER` joins (which join type that is used depends on how the association has been set up in your model). If all included associations are set on the current model, you can specify them in a list (e.g. `department,addresses,emails`). You can build more complex `include` strings by using parentheses when the association is set on an included model, like `album(artist(genre))`, for example. These complex `include` strings only work when `returnAs` is set to `query` though.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: ifNull
parameter.help: The value returned if no records are found. Common usage is to set this to `0` to make sure a numeric value is always returned instead of a blank string.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: mimeTypes
function.help: Returns an associated MIME type based on a file extension.

parameter.name: extension
parameter.help: The extension to get the MIME type for.

parameter.name: fallback
parameter.help: the fallback MIME type to return.

function.name: minimum
function.help: Calculates the minimum value for a given property. Uses the SQL function `MIN`. If no records can be found to perform the calculation on you can use the `ifNull` argument to decide what should be returned.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of the property to get the lowest value for (must be a property of a numeric data type).

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: include
parameter.help: Associations that should be included in the query using `INNER` or `LEFT OUTER` joins (which join type that is used depends on how the association has been set up in your model). If all included associations are set on the current model, you can specify them in a list (e.g. `department,addresses,emails`). You can build more complex `include` strings by using parentheses when the association is set on an included model, like `album(artist(genre))`, for example. These complex `include` strings only work when `returnAs` is set to `query` though.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: ifNull
parameter.help: The value returned if no records are found. Common usage is to set this to `0` to make sure a numeric value is always returned instead of a blank string.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: minuteSelectTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing one select form control for the minutes of an hour based on the supplied `name`.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: The minute that should be selected initially.

parameter.name: minuteStep
parameter.help: Pass in `10` to only show minute 10, 20, 30, etc.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

function.name: model
function.help: Returns a reference to the requested model so that class level methods can be called on it.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the model to get a reference to.

function.name: monthSelectTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a select form control for the months of the year based on the supplied `name`.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: The month that should be selected initially.

parameter.name: monthDisplay
parameter.help: Pass in `names`, `numbers`, or `abbreviations` to control display.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

function.name: nestedProperties
function.help: Allows for nested objects, structs, and arrays to be set from params and other generated data.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The association (or list of associations) you want to allow to be set through the params. This argument is also aliased as `associations`.

parameter.name: autoSave
parameter.help: Whether to save the association(s) when the parent object is saved.

parameter.name: allowDelete
parameter.help: Set `allowDelete` to `true` to tell Wheels to look for the property `_delete` in your model. If present and set to a value that evaluates to `true`, the model will be deleted when saving the parent.

parameter.name: sortProperty
parameter.help: Set `sortProperty` to a property on the object that you would like to sort by. The property should be numeric, should start with 1, and should be consecutive. Only valid with `hasMany` associations.

parameter.name: rejectIfBlank
parameter.help: A list of properties that should not be blank. If any of the properties are blank, any CRUD operations will be rejected.

function.name: new
function.help: Creates a new object based on supplied properties and returns it. The object is not saved to the database; it only exists in memory. Property names and values can be passed in either using named arguments or as a struct to the `properties` argument.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: The properties you want to set on the object (can also be passed in as named arguments).

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

function.name: obfuscateParam
function.help: Obfuscates a value. Typically used for hiding primary key values when passed along in the URL.

parameter.name: param
parameter.help: Value to obfuscate.

function.name: onlyProvides
function.help: Use this in an individual controller action to define which formats the action will respond with. This can be used to define provides behavior in individual actions or to override a global setting set with @provides in the controller's `init()`.

function.name: pagination
function.help: Returns a struct with information about the specificed paginated query. The keys that will be included in the struct are `currentPage`, `totalPages` and `totalRecords`.

parameter.name: handle
parameter.help: The handle given to the query to return pagination information for.

function.name: paginationLinks
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing links to pages based on a paginated query. Uses @linkTo internally to build the link, so you need to pass in a `route` name or a `controller`/`action`/`key` combination. All other @linkTo arguments can be supplied as well, in which case they are passed through directly to @linkTo. If you have paginated more than one query in the controller, you can use the `handle` argument to reference them. (Don't forget to pass in a `handle` to the @findAll function in your controller first.)

parameter.name: windowSize
parameter.help: The number of page links to show around the current page.

parameter.name: alwaysShowAnchors
parameter.help: Whether or not links to the first and last page should always be displayed.

parameter.name: anchorDivider
parameter.help: String to place next to the anchors on either side of the list.

parameter.name: linkToCurrentPage
parameter.help: Whether or not the current page should be linked to.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String or HTML to be prepended before result.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String or HTML to be appended after result.

parameter.name: prependToPage
parameter.help: String or HTML to be prepended before each page number.

parameter.name: prependOnFirst
parameter.help: Whether or not to prepend the `prependToPage` string on the first page in the list.

parameter.name: prependOnAnchor
parameter.help: Whether or not to prepend the `prependToPage` string on the anchors.

parameter.name: appendToPage
parameter.help: String or HTML to be appended after each page number.

parameter.name: appendOnLast
parameter.help: Whether or not to append the `appendToPage` string on the last page in the list.

parameter.name: appendOnAnchor
parameter.help: Whether or not to append the `appendToPage` string on the anchors.

parameter.name: classForCurrent
parameter.help: Class name for the current page number (if `linkToCurrentPage` is `true`, the class name will go on the `a` element. If not, a `span` element will be used).

parameter.name: handle
parameter.help: The handle given to the query that the pagination links should be displayed for.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the param that holds the current page number.

parameter.name: showSinglePage
parameter.help: Will show a single page when set to `true`. (The default behavior is to return an empty string when there is only one page in the pagination).

parameter.name: pageNumberAsParam
parameter.help: Decides whether to link the page number as a param or as part of a route. (The default behavior is `true`).

function.name: passwordField
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a password field form control based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

function.name: passwordFieldTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a password field form control based on the supplied `name`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to populate in tag's `value` attribute.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

function.name: pluginNames
function.help: Returns a list of all installed plugins' names.

function.name: pluralize
function.help: Returns the plural form of the passed in word. Can also pluralize a word based on a value passed to the `count` argument.

parameter.name: word
parameter.help: The word to pluralize.

parameter.name: count
parameter.help: Pluralization will occur when this value is not `1`.

parameter.name: returnCount
parameter.help: Will return `count` prepended to the pluralization when `true` and `count` is not `-1`.

function.name: primaryKey
function.help: Returns the name of the primary key for this model's table. This is determined through database introspection. If composite primary keys have been used, they will both be returned in a list. This function is also aliased as `primaryKeys()`.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: If you are accessing a composite primary key, pass the position of a single key to fetch.

function.name: primaryKeys
function.help: Alias for @primaryKey. Use this for better readability when you're accessing multiple primary keys.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: If you are accessing a composite primary key, pass the position of a single key to fetch.

function.name: properties
function.help: Returns a structure of all the properties with their names as keys and the values of the property as values.

function.name: property
function.help: Use this method to map an object property to either a table column with a different name than the property or to a SQL expression. You only need to use this method when you want to override the default object relational mapping that Wheels performs.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name that you want to use for the column or SQL function result in the CFML code.

parameter.name: column
parameter.help: The name of the column in the database table to map the property to.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.help: A SQL expression to use to calculate the property value.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: A custom label for this property to be referenced in the interface and error messages.

parameter.name: defaultValue
parameter.help: A default value for this property.

function.name: propertyIsPresent
function.help: Returns `true` if the specified property exists on the model and is not a blank string.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of property to inspect.

function.name: propertyNames
function.help: Returns a list of property names ordered by their respective column's ordinal position in the database table. Also includes calculated property names that will be generated by the Wheels ORM.

function.name: protectedProperties
function.help: Use this method to specify which properties cannot be set through mass assignment.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Property name (or list of property names) that are not allowed to be altered through mass assignment.

function.name: provides
function.help: Defines formats that the controller will respond with upon request. The format can be requested through a URL variable called `format`, by appending the format name to the end of a URL as an extension (when URL rewriting is enabled), or in the request header.

parameter.name: formats
parameter.help: Formats to instruct the controller to provide. Valid values are `html` (the default), `xml`, `json`, `csv`, `pdf`, and `xls`.

function.name: radioButton
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a radio button form control based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: tagValue
parameter.help: The value of the radio button when `selected`.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

function.name: radioButtonTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a radio button form control based on the supplied `name`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to populate in tag's `value` attribute.

parameter.name: checked
parameter.help: Whether or not to check the radio button by default.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

function.name: redirectTo
function.help: Redirects the browser to the supplied `controller`/`action`/`key`, `route` or back to the referring page. Internally, this function uses the @URLFor function to build the link and the `cflocation` tag to perform the redirect.

parameter.name: back
parameter.help: Set to `true` to redirect back to the referring page.

parameter.name: addToken
parameter.help: See documentation for your CFML engine's implementation of `cflocation`.

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.help: See documentation for your CFML engine's implementation of `cflocation`.

parameter.name: route
parameter.help: Name of a route that you have configured in `config/routes.cfm`.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.help: Name of the controller to include in the URL.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Name of the action to include in the URL.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key(s) to include in the URL.

parameter.name: params
parameter.help: Any additional params to be set in the query string.

parameter.name: anchor
parameter.help: Sets an anchor name to be appended to the path.

parameter.name: onlyPath
parameter.help: If `true`, returns only the relative URL (no protocol, host name or port).

parameter.name: host
parameter.help: Set this to override the current host.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: Set this to override the current protocol.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Set this to override the current port number.

parameter.name: delay
parameter.help: Set to `true` to delay the redirection until after the rest of your action code has executed.

function.name: reload
function.help: Reloads the property values of this object from the database.

function.name: renderNothing
function.help: Instructs the controller to render an empty string when it's finished processing the action. This is very similar to calling `cfabort` with the advantage that any after filters you have set on the action will still be run.

function.name: renderPage
function.help: Instructs the controller which view template and layout to render when it's finished processing the action. Note that when passing values for `controller` and/or `action`, this function does not load the actual action but rather just loads the corresponding view template.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.help: Controller to include the view page for.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Action to include the view page for.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: A specific template to render. Prefix with a leading slash `/` if you need to build a path from the root `views` folder.

parameter.name: layout
parameter.help: The layout to wrap the content in. Prefix with a leading slash `/` if you need to build a path from the root `views` folder. Pass `false` to not load a layout at all.

parameter.name: cache
parameter.help: Number of minutes to cache the content for.

parameter.name: returnAs
parameter.help: Set to `string` to return the result instead of automatically sending it to the client.

parameter.name: hideDebugInformation
parameter.help: Set to `true` to hide the debug information at the end of the output. This is useful when you're testing XML output in an environment where the global setting for `showDebugInformation` is `true`.

function.name: renderPartial
function.help: Instructs the controller to render a partial when it's finished processing the action.

parameter.name: partial
parameter.help: The name of the partial file to be used. Prefix with a leading slash `/` if you need to build a path from the root `views` folder. Do not include the partial filename's underscore and file extension.

parameter.name: cache
parameter.help: Number of minutes to cache the content for.

parameter.name: layout
parameter.help: The layout to wrap the content in. Prefix with a leading slash `/` if you need to build a path from the root `views` folder. Pass `false` to not load a layout at all.

parameter.name: returnAs
parameter.help: Set to `string` to return the result instead of automatically sending it to the client.

parameter.name: dataFunction
parameter.help: Name of a controller function to load data from.

function.name: renderText
function.help: Instructs the controller to render specified text when it's finished processing the action.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text to be rendered.

function.name: renderWith
function.help: Instructs the controller to render the data passed in to the format that is requested. If the format requested is `json` or `xml`, Wheels will transform the data into that format automatically. For other formats (or to override the automatic formatting), you can also create a view template in this format: `nameofaction.xml.cfm`, `nameofaction.json.cfm`, `nameofaction.pdf.cfm`, etc.

parameter.name: data
parameter.help: Data to format and render.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.help: Controller to include the view page for.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Action to include the view page for.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: A specific template to render. Prefix with a leading slash `/` if you need to build a path from the root `views` folder.

parameter.name: layout
parameter.help: The layout to wrap the content in. Prefix with a leading slash `/` if you need to build a path from the root `views` folder. Pass `false` to not load a layout at all.

parameter.name: cache
parameter.help: Number of minutes to cache the content for.

parameter.name: returnAs
parameter.help: Set to `string` to return the result instead of automatically sending it to the client.

parameter.name: hideDebugInformation
parameter.help: Set to `true` to hide the debug information at the end of the output. This is useful when you're testing XML output in an environment where the global setting for `showDebugInformation` is `true`.

function.name: resetCycle
function.help: Resets a cycle so that it starts from the first list value the next time it is called.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the cycle to reset.

function.name: response
function.help: Returns content that Wheels will send to the client in response to the request.

function.name: save
function.help: Saves the object if it passes validation and callbacks. Returns `true` if the object was saved successfully to the database, `false` if not.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: reload
parameter.help: Set to `true` to reload the object from the database once an insert/update has completed.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: Set to `false` to skip validations for this operation.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

function.name: secondSelectTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing one select form control for the seconds of a minute based on the supplied `name`.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: The second that should be selected initially.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

function.name: select
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a `select` form control based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: options
parameter.help: A collection to populate the select form control with. Can be a query recordset or an array of objects.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: valueField
parameter.help: The column or property to use for the value of each list element. Used only when a query or array of objects has been supplied in the `options` argument.

parameter.name: textField
parameter.help: The column or property to use for the value of each list element that the end user will see. Used only when a query or array of objects has been supplied in the `options` argument.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

function.name: selectTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a select form control based on the supplied `name` and `options`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: options
parameter.help: A collection to populate the select form control with. Can be a query recordset or an array of objects.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: Value of option that should be selected by default.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: multiple
parameter.help: Whether to allow multiple selection of options in the select form control.

parameter.name: valueField
parameter.help: The column or property to use for the value of each list element. Used only when a query or array of objects has been supplied in the `options` argument.

parameter.name: textField
parameter.help: The column or property to use for the value of each list element that the end user will see. Used only when a query or array of objects has been supplied in the `options` argument.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

function.name: sendEmail
function.help: Sends an email using a template and an optional layout to wrap it in. Besides the Wheels-specific arguments documented here, you can also pass in any argument that is accepted by the `cfmail` tag as well as your own arguments to be used by the view.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: The path to the email template or two paths if you want to send a multipart email. if the `detectMultipart` argument is `false`, the template for the text version should be the first one in the list. This argument is also aliased as `templates`.

parameter.name: from
parameter.help: Email address to send from.

parameter.name: to
parameter.help: List of email addresses to send the email to.

parameter.name: subject
parameter.help: The subject line of the email.

parameter.name: layout
parameter.help: Layout(s) to wrap the email template in. This argument is also aliased as `layouts`.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: A list of the names of the files to attach to the email. This will reference files stored in the `files` folder (or a path relative to it). This argument is also aliased as `files`.

parameter.name: detectMultipart
parameter.help: When set to `true` and multiple values are provided for the `template` argument, Wheels will detect which of the templates is text and which one is HTML (by counting the `<` characters).

function.name: sendFile
function.help: Sends a file to the user (from the `files` folder or a path relative to it by default).

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: The file to send to the user.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The file name to show in the browser download dialog box.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The HTTP content type to deliver the file as.

parameter.name: disposition
parameter.help: Set to `inline` to have the browser handle the opening of the file (possibly inline in the browser) or set to `attachment` to force a download dialog box.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Directory outside of the webroot where the file exists. Must be a full path.

parameter.name: deleteFile
parameter.help: Pass in `true` to delete the file on the server after sending it.

function.name: set
function.help: Use to configure a global setting or set a default for a function.

function.name: setFilterChain
function.help: Use this function if you need a more low level way of setting the entire filter chain for a controller.

parameter.name: chain
parameter.help: An array of structs, each of which represent an `argumentCollection` that get passed to the `filters` function. This should represent the entire filter chain that you want to use for this controller.

function.name: setPagination
function.help: Allows you to set a pagination handle for a custom query so you can perform pagination on it in your view with `paginationLinks()`.

parameter.name: totalRecords
parameter.help: Total count of records that should be represented by the paginated links.

parameter.name: currentPage
parameter.help: Page number that should be represented by the data being fetched and the paginated links.

parameter.name: perPage
parameter.help: Number of records that should be represented on each page of data.

parameter.name: handle
parameter.help: Name of handle to reference in @paginationLinks.

function.name: setPrimaryKey
function.help: Allows you to pass in the name(s) of the property(s) that should be used as the primary key(s). Pass as a list if defining a composite primary key. Also aliased as `setPrimaryKeys()`.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Property (or list of properties) to set as the primary key.

function.name: setPrimaryKeys
function.help: Alias for @setPrimaryKey. Use this for better readability when you're setting multiple properties as the primary key.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Property (or list of properties) to set as the primary key.

function.name: setProperties
function.help: Allows you to set all the properties of an object at once by passing in a structure with keys matching the property names.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: The properties you want to set on the object (can also be passed in as named arguments).

function.name: setResponse
function.help: Sets content that Wheels will send to the client in response to the request.

parameter.name: content
parameter.help: The content to set as the response.

function.name: setTableNamePrefix
function.help: Sets a prefix to prepend to the table name when this model runs SQL queries.

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.help: A prefix to prepend to the table name.

function.name: setVerificationChain
function.help: Use this function if you need a more low level way of setting the entire verification chain for a controller.

parameter.name: chain
parameter.help: An array of structs, each of which represent an `argumentCollection` that get passed to the `verifies` function. This should represent the entire verification chain that you want to use for this controller.

function.name: simpleFormat
function.help: Replaces single newline characters with HTML break tags and double newline characters with HTML paragraph tags (properly closed to comply with XHTML standards).

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text to format.

parameter.name: wrap
parameter.help: Set to `true` to wrap the result in a paragraph.

function.name: singularize
function.help: Returns the singular form of the passed in word.

parameter.name: word
parameter.help: String to singularize.

function.name: startFormTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing the opening form tag. The form's action will be built according to the same rules as `URLFor`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: The type of method to use in the form tag. `get` and `post` are the options.

parameter.name: multipart
parameter.help: Set to `true` if the form should be able to upload files.

parameter.name: spamProtection
parameter.help: Set to `true` to protect the form against spammers (done with JavaScript).

parameter.name: route
parameter.help: Name of a route that you have configured in `config/routes.cfm`.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.help: Name of the controller to include in the URL.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Name of the action to include in the URL.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key(s) to include in the URL.

parameter.name: params
parameter.help: Any additional params to be set in the query string.

parameter.name: anchor
parameter.help: Sets an anchor name to be appended to the path.

parameter.name: onlyPath
parameter.help: If `true`, returns only the relative URL (no protocol, host name or port).

parameter.name: host
parameter.help: Set this to override the current host.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: Set this to override the current protocol.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Set this to override the current port number.

function.name: stripLinks
function.help: Removes all links from an HTML string, leaving just the link text.

parameter.name: html
parameter.help: The HTML to remove links from.

function.name: stripTags
function.help: Removes all HTML tags from a string.

parameter.name: html
parameter.help: The HTML to remove tag markup from.

function.name: styleSheetLinkTag
function.help: Returns a `link` tag for a stylesheet (or several) based on the supplied arguments.

parameter.name: sources
parameter.help: The name of one or many CSS files in the `stylesheets` folder, minus the `.css` extension. (Can also be called with the `source` argument.)

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The `type` attribute for the `link` tag.

parameter.name: media
parameter.help: The `media` attribute for the `link` tag.

parameter.name: head
parameter.help: Set to `true` to place the output in the `head` area of the HTML page instead of the default behavior, which is to place the output where the function is called from.

function.name: submitTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a submit button `form` control. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Message to display in the button form control.

parameter.name: image
parameter.help: File name of the image file to use in the button form control.

parameter.name: disable
parameter.help: Whether or not to disable the button upon clicking. (prevents double-clicking.)

function.name: sum
function.help: Calculates the sum of values for a given property. Uses the SQL function `SUM`. If no records can be found to perform the calculation on you can use the `ifNull` argument to decide what should be returned.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of the property to get the sum for (must be a property of a numeric data type).

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: include
parameter.help: Associations that should be included in the query using `INNER` or `LEFT OUTER` joins (which join type that is used depends on how the association has been set up in your model). If all included associations are set on the current model, you can specify them in a list (e.g. `department,addresses,emails`). You can build more complex `include` strings by using parentheses when the association is set on an included model, like `album(artist(genre))`, for example. These complex `include` strings only work when `returnAs` is set to `query` though.

parameter.name: distinct
parameter.help: When `true`, `SUM` returns the sum of unique values only.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: ifNull
parameter.help: The value returned if no records are found. Common usage is to set this to `0` to make sure a numeric value is always returned instead of a blank string.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: table
function.help: Use this method to tell Wheels what database table to connect to for this model. You only need to use this method when your table naming does not follow the standard Wheels convention of a singular object name mapping to a plural table name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the table to map this model to.

function.name: tableName
function.help: Returns the name of the database table that this model is mapped to.

function.name: textArea
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a text area field form control based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

function.name: textAreaTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a text area form control based on the supplied `name`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: content
parameter.help: Content to display in `textarea` on page load.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel

parameter.name: appendToLabel

parameter.name: errorElement

parameter.name: errorClass

function.name: textFieldTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a text field form control based on the supplied `name`. Note: Pass any additional arguments like `class`, `rel`, and `id`, and the generated tag will also include those values as HTML attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to populate in tag's `value` attribute.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
