function.name: timeAgoInWords
function.help: Pass in a date to this method, and it will return a string describing the approximate time difference between that date and the current date.

parameter.name: fromTime
parameter.help: Date to compare from.

parameter.name: includeSeconds
parameter.help: Whether or not to include the number of seconds in the returned string.

parameter.name: toTime
parameter.help: Date to compare to.

function.name: timeSelect
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing three select form controls for hour, minute, and second based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`.

parameter.name: objectName
parameter.help: The variable name of the object to build the form control for.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: The name of the property to use in the form control.

parameter.name: association
parameter.help: The name of the association that the property is located on. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nesting, simply pass in a list to the nested object, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position used when referencing a `hasMany` relationship in the `association` argument. Used for building nested forms that work with nested properties. If you are building a form with deep nestings, simply pass in a list of positions, and Wheels will figure it out.

parameter.name: order
parameter.help: Use to change the order of or exclude time select tags.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Use to change the character that is displayed between the time select tags.

parameter.name: minuteStep
parameter.help: Pass in `10` to only show minute 10, 20, 30, etc.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control. The label will be applied to all `select` tags, but you can pass in a list to cutomize each one individually.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: errorElement
parameter.help: HTML tag to wrap the form control with when the object contains errors.

parameter.name: errorClass
parameter.help: The class name of the HTML tag that wraps the form control when there are errors.

parameter.name: combine
parameter.help: Set to `false` to not combine the select parts into a single `DateTime` object.

parameter.name: twelveHour
parameter.help: whether to display the hours in 24 or 12 hour format. 12 hour format has AM/PM drop downs

function.name: timeSelectTags
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing three select form controls for hour, minute, and second based on `name`.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: Value of option that should be selected by default.

parameter.name: order
parameter.help: Use to change the order of or exclude time select tags.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Use to change the character that is displayed between the time select tags.

parameter.name: minuteStep
parameter.help: Pass in `10` to only show minute 10, 20, 30, etc.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control. The label will be applied to all `select` tags, but you can pass in a list to cutomize each one individually.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: combine
parameter.help: Set to `false` to not combine the select parts into a single `DateTime` object.

parameter.name: twelveHour
parameter.help: whether to display the hours in 24 or 12 hour format. 12 hour format has AM/PM drop downs

function.name: timeUntilInWords
function.help: Pass in a date to this method, and it will return a string describing the approximate time difference between the current date and that date.

parameter.name: toTime
parameter.help: Date to compare to.

parameter.name: includeSeconds
parameter.help: Whether or not to include the number of seconds in the returned string.

parameter.name: fromTime
parameter.help: Date to compare from.

function.name: titleize
function.help: Capitalizes all words in the text to create a nicer looking title.

parameter.name: word
parameter.help: The text to turn into a title.

function.name: toggle
function.help: Assigns to the property specified the opposite of the property's current boolean value. Throws an error if the property cannot be converted to a boolean value. Returns this object if save called internally is `false`.

parameter.name: save
parameter.help: Argument to decide whether save the property after it has been toggled. Defaults to true.

function.name: toXHTML
function.help: Returns an XHTML-compliant string.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: String to make XHTML-compliant.

function.name: truncate
function.help: Truncates text to the specified length and replaces the last characters with the specified truncate string (which defaults to "...").

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text to truncate.

parameter.name: length
parameter.help: Length to truncate the text to.

parameter.name: truncateString
parameter.help: String to replace the last characters with.

function.name: update
function.help: Updates the object with the supplied properties and saves it to the database. Returns `true` if the object was saved successfully to the database and `false` otherwise.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: The properties you want to set on the object (can also be passed in as named arguments).

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: reload
parameter.help: Set to `true` to force Wheels to query the database even though an identical query may have been run in the same request. (The default in Wheels is to get the second query from the request-level cache.)

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: Set to `false` to skip validations for this operation.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

function.name: updateAll
function.help: Updates all properties for the records that match the `where` argument. Property names and values can be passed in either using named arguments or as a struct to the `properties` argument. By default, objects will not be instantiated and therefore callbacks and validations are not invoked. You can change this behavior by passing in `instantiate=true`. This method returns the number of records that were updated.

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: include
parameter.help: Associations that should be included in the query using `INNER` or `LEFT OUTER` joins (which join type that is used depends on how the association has been set up in your model). If all included associations are set on the current model, you can specify them in a list (e.g. `department,addresses,emails`). You can build more complex `include` strings by using parentheses when the association is set on an included model, like `album(artist(genre))`, for example. These complex `include` strings only work when `returnAs` is set to `query` though.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: The properties you want to set on the object (can also be passed in as named arguments).

parameter.name: reload
parameter.help: Set to `true` to force Wheels to query the database even though an identical query may have been run in the same request. (The default in Wheels is to get the second query from the request-level cache.)

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: instantiate
parameter.help: Whether or not to instantiate the object(s) first. When objects are not instantiated, any callbacks and validations set on them will be skipped.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: Set to `false` to skip validations for this operation.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: updateByKey
function.help: Finds the object with the supplied key and saves it (if validation permits it) with the supplied properties and/or named arguments. Property names and values can be passed in either using named arguments or as a struct to the `properties` argument. Returns `true` if the object was found and updated successfully, `false` otherwise.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Primary key value(s) of the record to fetch. Separate with comma if passing in multiple primary key values. Accepts a string, list, or a numeric value.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: The properties you want to set on the object (can also be passed in as named arguments).

parameter.name: reload
parameter.help: Set to `true` to force Wheels to query the database even though an identical query may have been run in the same request. (The default in Wheels is to get the second query from the request-level cache.)

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: Set to `false` to skip validations for this operation.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: updateOne
function.help: Gets an object based on the arguments used and updates it with the supplied properties. Returns `true` if an object was found and updated successfully, `false` otherwise.

parameter.name: where
parameter.help: This argument maps to the `WHERE` clause of the query. The following operators are supported: `=`, `!=`, `<>`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `LIKE`, `NOT LIKE`, `IN`, `NOT IN`, `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL`, `AND`, and `OR`. (Note that the key words need to be written in upper case.) You can also use parentheses to group statements. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: order
parameter.help: Maps to the `ORDER BY` clause of the query. You do not need to specify the table name(s); Wheels will do that for you.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: The properties you want to set on the object (can also be passed in as named arguments).

parameter.name: reload
parameter.help: Set to `true` to force Wheels to query the database even though an identical query may have been run in the same request. (The default in Wheels is to get the second query from the request-level cache.)

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: Set to `false` to skip validations for this operation.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

parameter.name: includeSoftDeletes
parameter.help: You can set this argument to `true` to include soft-deleted records in the results.

function.name: updateProperties
function.help: Updates all the properties from the `properties` argument or other named arguments. If the object is invalid, the save will fail and `false` will be returned.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Struct containing key/value pairs with properties and associated values that need to be updated globally.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: Set to `false` to skip validations for this operation.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

function.name: updateProperty
function.help: Updates a single property and saves the record without going through the normal validation procedure. This is especially useful for boolean flags on existing records.

parameter.name: property
parameter.help: Name of the property to update the value for globally.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to set on the given property globally.

parameter.name: parameterize
parameter.help: Set to `true` to use `cfqueryparam` on all columns, or pass in a list of property names to use `cfqueryparam` on those only.

parameter.name: transaction
parameter.help: Set this to `commit` to update the database when the save has completed, `rollback` to run all the database queries but not commit them, or `none` to skip transaction handling altogether.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

function.name: URLFor
function.help: Creates an internal URL based on supplied arguments.

parameter.name: route
parameter.help: Name of a route that you have configured in `config/routes.cfm`.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.help: Name of the controller to include in the URL.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Name of the action to include in the URL.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key(s) to include in the URL.

parameter.name: params
parameter.help: Any additional params to be set in the query string.

parameter.name: anchor
parameter.help: Sets an anchor name to be appended to the path.

parameter.name: onlyPath
parameter.help: If `true`, returns only the relative URL (no protocol, host name or port).

parameter.name: host
parameter.help: Set this to override the current host.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: Set this to override the current protocol.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Set this to override the current port number.

function.name: usesLayout
function.help: Used within a controller's `init()` method to specify controller- or action-specific layouts.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: Name of the layout template or method name you want to use

parameter.name: ajax
parameter.help: Name of the layout template you want to use for AJAX requests

parameter.name: except
parameter.help: List of actions that SHOULD NOT get the layout

parameter.name: only
parameter.help: List of action that SHOULD ONLY get the layout

parameter.name: useDefault
parameter.help: When specifying conditions or a method, pass `true` to use the default `layout.cfm` if none of the conditions are met

function.name: valid
function.help: Runs the validation on the object and returns `true` if it passes it. Wheels will run the validation process automatically whenever an object is saved to the database, but sometimes it's useful to be able to run this method to see if the object is valid without saving it to the database.

parameter.name: callbacks
parameter.help: Set to `false` to disable callbacks for this operation.

function.name: validate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called to validate objects before they are saved.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names to call. (Can also be called with the `method` argument.)

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validateOnCreate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called to validate new objects before they are inserted.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names to call. (Can also be called with the `method` argument.)

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validateOnUpdate
function.help: Registers method(s) that should be called to validate existing objects before they are updated.

parameter.name: methods
parameter.help: Method name or list of method names to call. (Can also be called with the `method` argument.)

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validatesConfirmationOf
function.help: Validates that the value of the specified property also has an identical confirmation value. (This is common when having a user type in their email address a second time to confirm, confirming a password by typing it a second time, etc.) The confirmation value only exists temporarily and never gets saved to the database. By convention, the confirmation property has to be named the same as the property with "Confirmation" appended at the end. Using the password example, to confirm our `password` property, we would create a property called `passwordConfirmation`.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Name of property or list of property names to validate against (can also be called with the `property` argument).

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help: Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`).

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validatesExclusionOf
function.help: Validates that the value of the specified property does not exist in the supplied list.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Name of property or list of property names to validate against (can also be called with the `property` argument).

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: Single value or list of values that should not be allowed.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help: Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`).

parameter.name: allowBlank
parameter.help: If set to `true`, validation will be skipped if the property value is an empty string or doesn't exist at all. This is useful if you only want to run this validation after it passes the @validatesPresenceOf test, thus avoiding duplicate error messages if it doesn't.

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validatesFormatOf
function.help: Validates that the value of the specified property is formatted correctly by matching it against a regular expression using the `regEx` argument and/or against a built-in CFML validation type using the `type` argument (`creditcard`, `date`, `email`, etc.).

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Name of property or list of property names to validate against (can also be called with the `property` argument).

parameter.name: regEx
parameter.help: Regular expression to verify against.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: One of the following types to verify against: `creditcard`, `date`, `email`, `eurodate`, `guid`, `social_security_number`, `ssn`, `telephone`, `time`, `URL`, `USdate`, `UUID`, `variableName`, `zipcode` (will be passed through to your CFML engine's `IsValid()` function).

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help: Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`).

parameter.name: allowBlank
parameter.help: If set to `true`, validation will be skipped if the property value is an empty string or doesn't exist at all. This is useful if you only want to run this validation after it passes the @validatesPresenceOf test, thus avoiding duplicate error messages if it doesn't.

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validatesInclusionOf
function.help: Validates that the value of the specified property exists in the supplied list.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Name of property or list of property names to validate against (can also be called with the `property` argument).

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: List of allowed values.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help: Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`).

parameter.name: allowBlank
parameter.help: If set to `true`, validation will be skipped if the property value is an empty string or doesn't exist at all. This is useful if you only want to run this validation after it passes the @validatesPresenceOf test, thus avoiding duplicate error messages if it doesn't.

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validatesLengthOf
function.help: Validates that the value of the specified property matches the length requirements supplied. Use the `exactly`, `maximum`, `minimum` and `within` arguments to specify the length requirements.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Name of property or list of property names to validate against (can also be called with the `property` argument).

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help: Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`).

parameter.name: allowBlank
parameter.help: If set to `true`, validation will be skipped if the property value is an empty string or doesn't exist at all. This is useful if you only want to run this validation after it passes the @validatesPresenceOf test, thus avoiding duplicate error messages if it doesn't.

parameter.name: exactly
parameter.help: The exact length that the property value must be.

parameter.name: maximum
parameter.help: The maximum length that the property value can be.

parameter.name: minimum
parameter.help: The minimum length that the property value can be.

parameter.name: within
parameter.help: A list of two values (minimum and maximum) that the length of the property value must fall within.

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validatesNumericalityOf
function.help: Validates that the value of the specified property is numeric.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Name of property or list of property names to validate against (can also be called with the `property` argument).

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help: Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`).

parameter.name: allowBlank
parameter.help: If set to `true`, validation will be skipped if the property value is an empty string or doesn't exist at all. This is useful if you only want to run this validation after it passes the @validatesPresenceOf test, thus avoiding duplicate error messages if it doesn't.

parameter.name: onlyInteger
parameter.help: Specifies whether the property value must be an integer.

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

parameter.name: odd
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not the value must be an odd number.

parameter.name: even
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not the value must be an even number.

parameter.name: greaterThan
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not the value must be greater than the supplied value.

parameter.name: greaterThanOrEqualTo
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not the value must be greater than or equal the supplied value.

parameter.name: equalTo
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not the value must be equal to the supplied value.

parameter.name: lessThan
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not the value must be less than the supplied value.

parameter.name: lessThanOrEqualTo
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not the value must be less than or equal the supplied value.

function.name: validatesPresenceOf
function.help: Validates that the specified property exists and that its value is not blank.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Name of property or list of property names to validate against (can also be called with the `property` argument).

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help: Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`).

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: validatesUniquenessOf
function.help: Validates that the value of the specified property is unique in the database table. Useful for ensuring that two users can't sign up to a website with identical screen names for example. When a new record is created, a check is made to make sure that no record already exists in the database with the given value for the specified property. When the record is updated, the same check is made but disregarding the record itself.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: Name of property or list of property names to validate against (can also be called with the `property` argument).

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help: Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`).

parameter.name: allowBlank
parameter.help: If set to `true`, validation will be skipped if the property value is an empty string or doesn't exist at all. This is useful if you only want to run this validation after it passes the @validatesPresenceOf test, thus avoiding duplicate error messages if it doesn't.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: One or more properties by which to limit the scope of the uniqueness constraint.

parameter.name: if
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `true` validation will run).

parameter.name: unless
parameter.help: String expression to be evaluated that decides if validation will be run (if the expression returns `false` validation will run).

function.name: verificationChain
function.help: Returns an array of all the verifications set on this controller in the order in which they will be executed.

function.name: verifies
function.help: Instructs Wheels to verify that some specific criterias are met before running an action.

parameter.name: only
parameter.help: List of action names to limit this verification to.

parameter.name: except
parameter.help: List of action names to exclude this verification from.

parameter.name: post
parameter.help: Set to `true` to verify that this is a `POST` request.

parameter.name: get
parameter.help: Set to `true` to verify that this is a `GET` request.

parameter.name: ajax
parameter.help: Set to `true` to verify that this is an AJAX request.

parameter.name: cookie
parameter.help: Verify that the passed in variable name exists in the `cookie` scope.

parameter.name: session
parameter.help: Verify that the passed in variable name exists in the `session` scope.

parameter.name: params
parameter.help: Verify that the passed in variable name exists in the `params` struct.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.help: Pass in the name of a function that should handle failed verifications. The default is to just abort the request when a verification fails.

parameter.name: cookieTypes
parameter.help: List of types to check each listed `cookie` value against (will be passed through to your CFML engine's `IsValid` function).

parameter.name: sessionTypes
parameter.help: List of types to check each list `session` value against (will be passed through to your CFML engine's `IsValid` function).

parameter.name: paramsTypes
parameter.help: List of types to check each `params` value against (will be passed through to your CFML engine's `IsValid` function).

function.name: wordTruncate
function.help: Truncates text to the specified length of words and replaces the remaining characters with the specified truncate string (which defaults to "...").

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text to truncate.

parameter.name: length
parameter.help: Number of words to truncate the text to.

parameter.name: truncateString
parameter.help: String to replace the last characters with.

function.name: yearSelectTag
function.help: Builds and returns a string containing a select form control for a range of years based on the supplied `name`.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to populate in tag's `name` attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: The year that should be selected initially.

parameter.name: startYear
parameter.help: First year in select list.

parameter.name: endYear
parameter.help: Last year in select list.

parameter.name: includeBlank
parameter.help: Whether to include a blank option in the select form control. Pass `true` to include a blank line or a string that should represent what display text should appear for the empty value (for example, "- Select One -").

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: The label text to use in the form control.

parameter.name: labelPlacement
parameter.help: Whether to place the label `before`, `after`, or wrapped `around` the form control.

parameter.name: prepend
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: append
parameter.help: String to append to the form control. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: prependToLabel
parameter.help: String to prepend to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.

parameter.name: appendToLabel
parameter.help: String to append to the form control's `label`. Useful to wrap the form control with HTML tags.
